Select highly variable genes using second-moment approach

Source: R/create_scht.R
dot-select_hvgs.Rd

Identifies highly variable genes using matrix operations for efficient analysis with large datasets. Variance is computed by subtracting the square of the mean from the mean of squares.

Usage

.select_hvgs(gene_mat, n_hvg, qc_params, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

gene_mat

Normalised gene expression matrix.

n_hvg

Number of HVGs to select.

qc_params

QC parameters list; must contain min_cells_expressing.

verbose

Logical indicating whether to display progress messages.

Value

A list containing selected HVGs and metrics:

var_genes

Character vector of selected HVG names.

dispersion

Named numeric vector of dispersion values (variance-to-mean ratio).

mean_expr

Named numeric vector of mean expression values for the selected genes.
